revised_title: Deep Sea Bed: Calcium Carbonate Dissolution Rates in Turbidite Sediments
tldr: This study investigates the rate of calcium carbonate dissolution from the surface of deep-ocean turbidite sediments. The researchers found that the dissolution rate increases with the degree of undersaturation in the bottom water. They used a mathematical model and field data from a 5430-depth Atlantic site to explore the applicability of their method. The results provide insights into the preservation of carbonate minerals in deep-sea sediments and its relation to atmospheric carbon dioxide levels.
